==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|掃|墨}}

===Etymology===
paizumi > ɸaizumi > haizumi. From {{m|ja|掃き墨|tr=hakizumi}}, the medial -k- drops out; literally "brushed ink". The kanji [[灰墨]] are [[w:Ateji|ateji]] and is historically phonologically implausible.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|/haizumi/|lang=ja}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|ja|灰墨}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|はいずみ}}

# an ink made from various oils and mixed with a sticky glue; used as paint, eyebrow makeup, and in medicine
